event.name: The Ethereum Issuance Forum
event.organizer: Organized by the Ethereum Foundation — RIG & Protocol Support

hero.text: A curated forum to discuss the responsible evolution of Ethereum issuance.

about.label: About the Event
about.heading: Building shared context around issuance policy
paragraphs: The Ethereum Issuance Forum is a targeted event to increase transparency and build shared context surrounding research into Ethereum's issuance policy.
Hosted by the Ethereum Foundation Robust Incentives Group & Protocol Support team, the goal is to surface community considerations, trade-offs, and open questions to inform the research process.
This is not a decision-making body, but a space for exploration and understanding—bringing together researchers, validators, and community members for structured dialogue.

agenda.label: Agenda
agenda.heading:
Three hours of
focused dialogue
agenda.intro: The event spans approximately three hours, with breaks for informal conversation and connection.

items.title: Level-setting Presentations
items.description: Researchers present current context and modeling. These talks will be recorded and published to ensure transparency for the wider community.

items.title: Moderated Forum
items.description: A discussion where all participants have the opportunity to speak and discuss issuance policy considerations. To encourage open dialogue, this portion will not be recorded.

items.title: Networking
items.description: Informal time to connect with peers and researchers. Continue conversations and build lasting relationships within the community.

agenda.note: A detailed schedule will be released closer to the event date.

items.question: Do I need an EthCC ticket to attend?
items.answer: Yes. As the forum is hosted within the EthCC venue, a valid conference ticket is required for entry.

items.question: What is the goal of this forum?
items.answer: The primary goal is to build context and reduce uncertainty. We are here to explore and inform, not to vote or finalize a specific policy. The output will be summaries of themes and considerations that help inform the broader research process.

items.question: How does registration work?
items.answer: This is an event with limited capacity—approximately 85 attendees—to ensure productive discussion. Because space is limited, not all who apply will be able to attend.

items.question: Will the session be recorded?
items.answer: Yes and no. The introductory presentations will be recorded and shared publicly. The forum discussion itself will not be recorded to allow participants to speak freely.
